result.execSummary:
The defendant Leroy Stanton Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault/Use of Force, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(2)(a).
  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Restitution (surcharges applicable) in the amount of $10 payable to the Crime Victim Compensation fund.

EACH COUNT: Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
The Court is imposing the applicable fees, assessments, restitution, court costs, and surcharges, including a DNA assessment.  And, you may have to give a swab, which you might be able to have expunged under 165.77.
The Court orders the DOC to collect any monetary amounts ordered today at the rate of max 25% of any amounts provided in secs 973.05(4)(b) and 973.20 while the defendant is in their control.  Any monetary amounts that remain unpaid when the defendant is released from confinement are to be paid as a condition of the extended supervision.  Any monetary mounts that remain unpaid when the sentence is completed are ordered reduced to a judgment against the defendant for the unpaid balance and collection can then proceed under sec. 71.935 as well as other collection procedures.
Concurrent with: CONCURRENT TO COUNT 2 AND REVOCATION SENTENCE, with credit for 303 days time served.

superMiscConds.notes:
Maintain absolute sobriety with random urine screens.
Defendant has a lifetime sex offender registration.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his/her voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Concurrent with: CONCURRENT TO COUNT 1, with credit for 303 days time served

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Leroy Stanton in court with attorney Eamon Collins Guerin.  Defendant Leroy Stanton in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
PRIVATE  Presentence report reviewed.  Statements made as to sentencing.  
AS TO COUNT 1: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 28 YEARS CONCURRENT TO COUNT 2 AND REVOCATION SENTENCE, with credit for 303 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 18 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 10 YEARS.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".
AS TO COUNT 2: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3 YEARS and 6 MONTHS CONCURRENT TO COUNT 1, with credit for 303 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1  YEAR and 6 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".

*Maintain absolute sobriety with random urine screens.
Defendant has a lifetime sex offender registration.
NO CONTACT ORDER REMAINS.
Restitution (surcharges applicable) in the amount of $10 payable to the Crime Victim Compensation  fund. 
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
The Court is imposing the applicable fees, assessments, restitution, court costs, and surcharges, including a DNA assessment.  And, you may have to give a swab, which you might be able to have expunged under 165.77.
The Court orders the DOC to collect any monetary amounts ordered today at the rate of max 25% of any amounts provided in secs 973.05(4)(b) and 973.20 while the defendant is in their control.  Any monetary amounts that remain unpaid when the defendant is released from confinement are to be paid as a condition of the extended supervision.  Any monetary mounts that remain unpaid when the sentence is completed are ordered reduced to a judgment against the defendant for the unpaid balance and collection can then proceed under sec. 71.935 as well as other collection procedures.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his/her voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;

Defense's Motion to Challenge the Jury Array.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 19, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Leroy Stanton in court with Attorney Eamon Collins Guerin.  Defendant Leroy Stanton in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case recalled.
Exhibit # 12 and # 13 marked for identification
1:47 p.m.  Jury in the box
Sworn and testified for the State:  City of Milwaukee Police Dept. Officer Scott Strong.
Sworn and testified for the State:  Aurora Health Care/Clinical Nurse Specialist Sharain Horn
Sworn and testified for the State:  City of Milwaukee Police Dept. Officer Amy Stolowski
Exhibits # 1 through # 13 offered and received.  State rests subject to rebuttal.
2:48 p.m.  Jury out of the box
Defense counsel motion to dismiss denied by the Court.
Court reviews jury instructions with the parties.
Court holds colloquy with the defendant regarding his right to testify and finds the defendant knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily waives his right to testify.
3:32 p.m.  Jury in the box.  Defense rests
Court instructs the jury.  Closing arguments by the State and defense counsel.
Court charges the jury.
At the hour of 4:28 p.m. the jury retired to deliberate under the charge of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Dept. Deputies M. Metz and K. Regan who were duly sworn for that purpose.
Milwaukee County Sheriff's Dept. Deputy G. Bird sworn to take charge of jury under deliberations.
At the hour of 4:54 p.m. the jury returned and by their foreperson returned a verdict as follows:
"We, the jury, find the defendant, Mr. Leroy Stanton, Jr., guilty of Second Degree Sexual Assault as charged in count one of the information."   - signed by the foreperson and dated 09-24-15
"We, the jury, find the defendant, Mr. Leroy Stanton, Jr., guilty of Substantial Battery as charged in count two of the information."    -  signed by the foreperson and dated 09-24-15
Court polls the jury.
Jury panel released at 4:58 p.m.
State's motion for judgment of conviction based on the verdicts; defense counsel motion for acquittal not withstanding the verdicts.  Court grants State's motion and order judgment of conviction on the verdicts.
No PSI requested.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.  Court orders case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 7.
Clerk:  jms
Jurors sworn. Opening statements by state and defense.  Court gives jury instructions. Sworn for the state:  Sherry G., Vontress S., Betty H. Exhibits  1-11 received.

Case set for jury trial. State requested an adjournment due to witness unavailability. Court took a brief break and conferred with the parties in chambers. In chambers discussion placed on the record. Court granted the State's request for an adjournment of the jury trial date. Parties advised as of 8/01/15 this case will be assigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 7 in Room 620 of the Safety Building. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Jury trial scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Leroy Stanton in court with attorney Eamon Collins Guerin.  Defendant Leroy Stanton in custody.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for Kevin Shomin for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Final Pretrial. Parties prepared to proceed to trial. State placed offer on the record. Parties to file motions by 5-29-2015. Any motions requiring testimony will be heard on the final pretrial date. Parties to file witness lists, jury instructions, and motions in limine by the final pretrial date. State to file proposed verdict forms and substantive jury instructions by the final pretrial date. Parties are to advise the Court if a resolution is reached prior to the Jury Trial date. Case remains set for Jury Trial on 6/17/2015 at 9:00am. Case adjourned to branch 25.

Branch 25 will now be down on 5/13/15 and unable to hear the jury trial on this date. Parties notified and do not object to an adjournment. Jury Trial rescheduled to 6/17/15 at 9:00 a.m. in Branch 25. Final Pretrial currently scheduled for 4/02/15 at 8:30 a.m. remains the same. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel waives defendant's appearance for this hearing. Parties are still in negotiations and request final pretrial and jury trial dates. Final pre-trial scheduled for April 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 13, 2015 at 09:00 am.
